name: ActivityBrain
overview:
Activitybrain is based around a fully featured event creation system that offers users the ability to create one-time or repeating events in an easy to use interface. Members also have the option of using the unique and innovative â€œBrainâ€ to suggest the best time to meet for the event.

Users are able to log into the website using their facebook account (which imports all friends to ActivityBrain) or by creating a new account. Once logged in, the home page offers suggestions for activities that fit the members interests and free times. From there they can create the activity with just a few clicks.

The core feature of the site is its event creation system. Users have the option of selecting the best time and date of the activity (one-time or repeating) or they can get help from “The Brain”. The Brain looks through inviteeâ€™s schedules and finds the best time they are available to meet. For example, if a student wanted to get a group meeting together, they would be able to ask the brain for help and see the common free time among the groupâ€™s schedules. An event creator also has the option of letting the brain evolve a best time as invitees sign up for the event. Examples of how the different activity creation methods work can be found here: http://www.activitybrain.com/tour

Each event that gets created receives a dedicated activity page. Here, the invitees can RSVP, add comments, and view details about the event. If the event is repeating, an invitee can forward to a future date to RSVP and add comments.
